p: Different studies have demonstrated a wide variety of biological activities for red propolis extracts, such as antioxidant [ 2, 19], antimicrobial [ 27, 28], antitumor [ 1, 29, 30], anti-inflammatory [ 31, 32], antiparasitic [ 33â€“ 35], and anti-nociceptive activities [ 32]. Red propolis is currently recognized as the most promising type of propolis because of its biotechnological potential. The phenolic compounds, including the flavonoids, have been considered the main biologically active constituents of this resin, together with the cinnamic acid derivatives, esters, and some terpenes [ 3, 25].
